data.title: Person:Sarah George (29)
data.text:
Facts and Events

Name[1][2][3][4][5][6][7] Sarah Anne George Gender Female Birth[1][2][3][4][5][6][7] Llanishen, Monmouthshire, Wales, United Kingdom Residence[3] St Briavels, Gloucestershire, England Residence[1] St Briavel, Gloucestershire, England Marriage Llanishen,Monmouthshire, WalesCarpenter at marriage.

to Henry Harris Other[2] The departure port was Liverpool according to family records. Uncle Ted (Edwin George, Sarah's brother) carried young Emily onto the ship at the Port. Arrival Residence[4] Civil Districts 3, 5, Fentress, Tennessee Residence[2] Civil District 3, Fentress, Tennessee Death[5][6][7] Allardt, Fentress, Tennessee, USA

In 1910 census in Allardt, "six children, five living".

Married 1867 according to 1900 census for Allardt, TN Birthdate Mar 1841, according to 1900 US census

[update: wedding from Monmouth records, 24 Dec 1866 in Llanishen]

Death record Allardt: Harris, Sarah A., Date of death: 4-9-1912, Sex: F Age: 76, Married or single: M, Place of death: Allardt, TN Cause: General Debility, Born: Wails Occupation: Mother & Housewife, Physician: I. L. Garrett

Notes: http://beta.familysearch.org/s/recordDetails/show?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fpilot.familysearch.org%2Frecords%2Ftrk%3A%2Ffsrs%2Frr_932604854%2Fp1&hash=MPAfKvgWGXfZ5STyuqUCQxOVNk8%253D

GREATLY indebted to "Monmouthshire Family Pedigrees" of mdjohn@ntlworld.com

There is also a great discussion group: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/monfh/

This is a tree constructed from a variety of sources; some original work on New England, otherwise using NEHGS and other "respectable" sources. Medieval is from genealogics.org, (used as a check on) ancestry.com, and a few amendments from medieval genealogy -- soc.genealogy.medieval
